def get_trial(self, trial, pre=60, post=60, to_norm=False, flip_vertical=False): 
870    def get_trial(self, trial, pre=60, post=60, to_norm=False, flip_vertical=False):
871        """
872        Extract a time window around a given trigger (trial).
873
874        The trial window is centered on the trigger timestamp and extends
875        `pre` frames before and `post` frames after.
876
877        Parameters
878        ----------
879        trial : int
880            Index of the trigger (trial) to extract.
881        pre : int, optional
882            Number of frames before the trigger to include.
883        post : int, optional
884            Number of frames after the trigger to include.
885        to_norm : bool, optional
886            If True, frames are converted to normalized grayscale and mean-centered.
887        flip_vertical : bool, optional
888            If True, frames are flipped vertically.
889
890        Returns
891        -------
892        res : numpy.ndarray
893            Extracted frames with shape (pre + post, H, W, 3) for RGB, or
894            (pre + post, H, W) if `to_norm` is True.
895        trg : numpy.ndarray
896            A 1D array (length equal to number of frames) with a single 1
897            at the trigger index and 0 elsewhere.
898        """
899
900        i = self.trigger_timestamp[trial] - pre  # Example start frame
901        z = self.trigger_timestamp[trial] + post  # Example end frame
902        res = np.zeros((z - i, self.height, self.width, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
903        trg = np.zeros((z - i, 1))
904        trg[pre + 1] = 1
905        self.gotoframe(i)
906        for i, f in enumerate(range(i, z)):
907            # frame = self.cap.read()[1]
908            frame = self.get_next_frame(flip_vertical=flip_vertical)
909            if to_norm:
910                frame = cv2.cvtColor(frame, cv2.COLOR_RGB2GRAY).astype('float32') / 255
911                frame = frame - np.mean(frame)
912            res[i, :, :, :] = frame
913        return res, trg

Extract a time window around a given trigger (trial).

The trial window is centered on the trigger timestamp and extends pre frames before and post frames after.

Parameters

trial : int Index of the trigger (trial) to extract. pre : int, optional Number of frames before the trigger to include. post : int, optional Number of frames after the trigger to include. to_norm : bool, optional If True, frames are converted to normalized grayscale and mean-centered. flip_vertical : bool, optional If True, frames are flipped vertically.

Returns

res : numpy.ndarray Extracted frames with shape (pre + post, H, W, 3) for RGB, or (pre + post, H, W) if to_norm is True. trg : numpy.ndarray A 1D array (length equal to number of frames) with a single 1 at the trigger index and 0 elsewhere.

def preview_trial( self, trial_num, pre=60, post=60, showlabels=True, repeat=False, window='Frame', movements=True, movements_overlay=False, ylims=(0, 60000)): 
 915    def preview_trial(self, trial_num, pre=60, post=60, showlabels=True, repeat=False, window='Frame', movements=True,
 916                      movements_overlay=False, ylims=(0, 60000)):
 917        """
 918        Preview a single trial as an OpenCV window animation.
 919
 920        The method extracts a trial window, optionally overlays labels,
 921        highlights movement, and allows repeated playback until 'q' is pressed.
 922
 923        Parameters
 924        ----------
 925        trial_num : int
 926            Index of the trial to preview.
 927        pre : int, optional
 928            Frames before the trigger to include.
 929        post : int, optional
 930            Frames after the trigger to include.
 931        showlabels : bool, optional
 932            If True, shows trial, intensity, and PRE/POST labels on the frame.
 933        repeat : bool, optional
 934            If True, loops the trial playback.
 935        window : str, optional
 936            Name of the OpenCV window.
 937        movements : bool, optional
 938            If True, computes and optionally overlays movement information.
 939        movements_overlay : bool, optional
 940            If True, overlays motion mask on the video frames.
 941        ylims : tuple, optional
 942            Y-axis limits for the movement trace drawn on the frame.
 943
 944        Returns
 945        -------
 946        None
 947            The function opens an OpenCV window and blocks until playback ends
 948            or 'q' is pressed.
 949        """
 950        trial, trg = self.get_trial(trial_num, pre, post, )
 951        text_stage = 'PRE'
 952        f = 0
 953        if movements:
 954            movement_indices = list()
 955        prev_image = []
 956        while True:  # for f in range(0,trial.shape[0]):
 957            image = trial[f, :, :, :]
 958
 959            if showlabels:
 960                text = f'Trial: {trial_num}'
 961                text_intensity = f'Intensity: {self.stim_intensity[trial_num]}'
 962
 963                text_size = cv2.getTextSize(text, self.font, self.font_scale, self.thickness)[0]
 964                text_x = image.shape[1] - text_size[0] - 10  # 10 pixels from the right edge
 965                text_y = text_size[1] + 10  # 10 pixels from the top
 966
 967                text_size_int = cv2.getTextSize(text_intensity, self.font, self.font_scale, self.thickness)[0]
 968                text_x_int = image.shape[1] - text_size_int[0] - 10  # 10 pixels from the right edge
 969                text_y_int = text_size[1] + text_size_int[1] + 20  # 10 pixels from the top
 970
 971                text_size_stage = cv2.getTextSize(text_stage, self.font, self.font_scale, self.thickness)[0]
 972                text_x_stage = image.shape[1] - text_size_stage[0] - 10  # 10 pixels from the right edge
 973                text_y_stage = text_size[1] + text_size_stage[1] + text_size_stage[1] + 30  # 10 pixels from the top
 974
 975                if trg[f]:
 976                    cv2.putText(image, text, (text_x, text_y), self.font, self.font_scale, self.color_stim,
 977                                self.thickness)
 978                    cv2.putText(image, text_intensity, (text_x_int, text_y_int), self.font, self.font_scale,
 979                                self.color_stim, self.thickness)
 980                    text_stage = 'POST'
 981                else:
 982                    cv2.putText(image, text, (text_x, text_y), self.font, self.font_scale, self.color, self.thickness)
 983                    cv2.putText(image, text_intensity, (text_x_int, text_y_int), self.font, self.font_scale, self.color,
 984                                self.thickness)
 985
 986                cv2.putText(image, text_stage, (text_x_stage, text_y_stage), self.font, self.font_scale, self.color,
 987                            self.thickness)
 988
 989            if movements:
 990                if len(prev_image):
 991                    thresh_frame, movement_index = self.frame_movements(prev_image[10:, 10:, :], image[10:, 10:, :])
 992                    movement_indices.append(movement_index)
 993                    alpha = 0.5
 994                    overlay = image.copy()
 995                    overlay[10:, 10:, :][thresh_frame != 0] = [0, 0, 255]
 996                    if movements_overlay:
 997                        combined_frame = cv2.addWeighted(overlay, alpha, image, 1 - alpha, 0)
 998                        combined_frame = self.draw_plot_on_frame(combined_frame, movement_indices, 50, ymin=ylims[0],
 999                                                                 ymax=ylims[1])
1000                    else:
1001                        combined_frame = self.draw_plot_on_frame(image, movement_indices, 50, ymin=ylims[0],
1002                                                                 ymax=ylims[1])
1003                else:
1004                    combined_frame = image
1005                cv2.imshow(window, combined_frame)
1006            else:
1007                cv2.imshow(window, image)
1008
1009            prev_image = image
1010            if cv2.waitKey(int((1 / self.fps) * 1000)) & 0xFF == ord('q'):
1011                break
1012
1013            if f < trial.shape[0] - 1:
1014                f += 1
1015            else:
1016                if repeat:
1017                    f = 0
1018                    text_stage = 'PRE'
1019                    prev_image = []
1020                    if movements:
1021                        movement_indices = list()
1022                else:
1023                    break
1024        cv2.destroyAllWindows()

Preview a single trial as an OpenCV window animation.

The method extracts a trial window, optionally overlays labels, highlights movement, and allows repeated playback until 'q' is pressed.

Parameters

trial_num : int Index of the trial to preview. pre : int, optional Frames before the trigger to include. post : int, optional Frames after the trigger to include. showlabels : bool, optional If True, shows trial, intensity, and PRE/POST labels on the frame. repeat : bool, optional If True, loops the trial playback. window : str, optional Name of the OpenCV window. movements : bool, optional If True, computes and optionally overlays movement information. movements_overlay : bool, optional If True, overlays motion mask on the video frames. ylims : tuple, optional Y-axis limits for the movement trace drawn on the frame.

Returns

None The function opens an OpenCV window and blocks until playback ends or 'q' is pressed.

def previewAllTrials2GIF( self, pre=100, post=100, frame_height=700, gif_filename=None, resize_factor=1.0, dither=False, palette=256): 
1192    def previewAllTrials2GIF(self, pre=100, post=100, frame_height=700,
1193                             gif_filename=None,
1194                             resize_factor=1.0,
1195                             dither=False,
1196                             palette=256):
1197        """
1198        Generate and save a GIF preview of the full trial mosaic.
1199
1200        This method builds the same mosaic representation used by
1201        `previewAllTrials`, but then exports it as an optimized GIF using PIL.
1202
1203        Parameters
1204        ----------
1205        pre : int, optional
1206            Frames before each trigger to include in each trial window.
1207        post : int, optional
1208            Frames after each trigger to include.
1209        frame_height : int, optional
1210            Height of the mosaic in pixels.
1211        gif_filename : str, optional
1212            Output GIF filename. If None, uses "<rec>.gif".
1213        resize_factor : float, optional
1214            Scale factor applied to the final frames (1.0 = full size, 0.5 = half).
1215        dither : bool, optional
1216            If True, enables Floyd-Steinberg dithering in the palette reduction.
1217        palette : int, optional
1218            Size of the color palette (max 256).
1219
1220        Returns
1221        -------
1222        None
1223            Writes an animated GIF to disk.
1224        """
1225
1226        from PIL import Image
1227
1228        if gif_filename is None:
1229            gif_filename = self.rec + '.gif'
1230
1231        frame_width = frame_height * (self.resolution[1] // self.resolution[0])
1232        big_frame_res = (frame_height, frame_width)
1233        rows, cols = len(self.stimuli[0]), np.max(self.stimuli[1])
1234        resize_to = big_frame_res[0] // rows, frame_width // cols
1235
1236        big_frame = np.zeros((pre + post, big_frame_res[0], big_frame_res[1], 3),
1237                             dtype=np.uint8)
1238
1239        col = 0
1240        row_poses = np.arange(0, big_frame_res[0], resize_to[0])
1241        col_poses = np.arange(0, big_frame_res[1], resize_to[1])
1242        col_pos = 0
1243        row_pos = 0
1244
1245        # Fill mosaic
1246        for i, row in enumerate(self.stim_intensity):
1247            if i > 0 and row == 0:
1248                col += 1
1249                col_pos = col_poses[col]
1250
1251            row_pos = row_poses[row]
1252            trl, trg = self.get_trial(i, pre, post)
1253
1254            trl_resized = np.zeros((trl.shape[0], resize_to[0], resize_to[1], 3),
1255                                   dtype=np.uint8)
1256            text = f'T:{i} I:{row}'
1257            text_size = cv2.getTextSize(text, cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX,
1258                                        0.5, 1)[0]
1259            text_x = resize_to[1] - text_size[0]
1260            text_y = text_size[1]
1261
1262            for j, frame in enumerate(trl):
1263                resiz = cv2.resize(frame, (resize_to[1], resize_to[0]),
1264                                   interpolation=cv2.INTER_LINEAR)
1265
1266                color = (255, 0, 0) if trg[j] else (255, 255, 255)
1267                resiz = cv2.putText(resiz, text, (text_x, text_y),
1268                                    cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX,
1269                                    0.5, color, 1)
1270
1271                trl_resized[j] = resiz
1272
1273            for f in range(trl.shape[0]):
1274                big_frame[f,
1275                row_pos:row_pos + resize_to[0],
1276                col_pos:col_pos + resize_to[1]] = trl_resized[f]
1277
1278        # Convert to PIL images with quantization and optimization
1279        frames = []
1280        for i in range(big_frame.shape[0]):
1281            im = Image.fromarray(cv2.cvtColor(big_frame[i], cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB))
1282
1283            # optional resize
1284            if resize_factor != 1.0:
1285                new_w = int(im.width * resize_factor)
1286                new_h = int(im.height * resize_factor)
1287                im = im.resize((new_w, new_h), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)
1288
1289            # reduce palette (massive file size reduction)
1290            dither_flag = Image.Dither.FLOYDSTEINBERG if dither else Image.Dither.NONE
1291            im = im.quantize(colors=palette, method=Image.MEDIANCUT, dither=dither_flag)
1292
1293            frames.append(im)
1294
1295        # Save optimized GIF
1296        frames[0].save(
1297            gif_filename,
1298            save_all=True,
1299            append_images=frames[1:],
1300            optimize=True,
1301            duration=int(1000 / self.fps),
1302            loop=0,
1303            disposal=2
1304        )
1305
1306        print("GIF saved:", gif_filename)

@staticmethod
def frame_movements(prev_frame, curr_frame, gfilt=5, thr=10): 
1358    @staticmethod
1359    def frame_movements(prev_frame, curr_frame, gfilt=5, thr=10):
1360        """
1361        Compute movement between two frames using absolute difference.
1362
1363        Both frames are blurred, subtracted, thresholded, and the number of
1364        non-zero pixels in the thresholded image is used as a movement index.
1365
1366        Parameters
1367        ----------
1368        prev_frame : numpy.ndarray
1369            Previous frame (HxW or HxWx3).
1370        curr_frame : numpy.ndarray
1371            Current frame (HxW or HxWx3).
1372        gfilt : int, optional
1373            Gaussian kernel size used for blurring.
1374        thr : int, optional
1375            Threshold for detecting motion in the difference image.
1376
1377        Returns
1378        -------
1379        thresh_frame : numpy.ndarray
1380            Thresholded difference frame, same size as input frames.
1381        movement_index : int
1382            Number of non-zero pixels in `thresh_frame`, indicating motion level.
1383        """
1384
1385        if len(curr_frame.shape) > 2:
1386            curr_frame = cv2.cvtColor(curr_frame, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
1387
1388        if len(prev_frame.shape) > 2:
1389            prev_frame = cv2.cvtColor(prev_frame, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
1390
1391        curr_frame = cv2.GaussianBlur(curr_frame, (gfilt, gfilt), 0)
1392        prev_frame = cv2.GaussianBlur(prev_frame, (gfilt, gfilt), 0)
1393
1394        diff_frame = cv2.absdiff(prev_frame, curr_frame)
1395        _, thresh_frame = cv2.threshold(diff_frame, thr, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY)
1396        movement_index = cv2.countNonZero(thresh_frame)
1397        return thresh_frame, movement_index

Compute movement between two frames using absolute difference.

Both frames are blurred, subtracted, thresholded, and the number of non-zero pixels in the thresholded image is used as a movement index.

Parameters

prev_frame : numpy.ndarray Previous frame (HxW or HxWx3). curr_frame : numpy.ndarray Current frame (HxW or HxWx3). gfilt : int, optional Gaussian kernel size used for blurring. thr : int, optional Threshold for detecting motion in the difference image.

Returns

thresh_frame : numpy.ndarray Thresholded difference frame, same size as input frames. movement_index : int Number of non-zero pixels in thresh_frame, indicating motion level.

@staticmethod
def phase_scramble_image(frame, phase_scrambling_matrix=None, seed=None, to_rgb=False): 
1427    @staticmethod
1428    def phase_scramble_image(frame, phase_scrambling_matrix=None, seed=None, to_rgb=False):
1429        """
1430        Apply Fourier phase scrambling to an image.
1431
1432        The magnitude spectrum is preserved while phase is randomized or
1433        shuffled, which preserves low-level statistics but disrupts semantic
1434        content.
1435
1436        Parameters
1437        ----------
1438        frame : numpy.ndarray
1439            Input image (HxWx3, BGR).
1440        phase_scrambling_matrix : numpy.ndarray, optional
1441            Precomputed phase matrix to reuse for temporal consistency.
1442        seed : int, optional
1443            Random seed for reproducibility when generating new phase matrices.
1444        to_rgb : bool, optional
1445            If True, the output is converted back to 3-channel RGB.
1446
1447        Returns
1448        -------
1449        scrambled_frame_normalized : numpy.ndarray
1450            Phase-scrambled image in uint8.
1451        phase_scrambling_matrix : numpy.ndarray
1452            Phase matrix used for scrambling, which can be reused for other frames.
1453        """
1454
1455        if seed is not None:
1456            np.random.seed(seed)
1457        gray_frame = cv2.cvtColor(frame, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
1458
1459        f_transform = np.fft.fft2(gray_frame)
1460        f_shift = np.fft.fftshift(f_transform)
1461        if phase_scrambling_matrix is None:
1462            #    phase_scrambling_matrix = np.exp(1j * np.random.uniform(0, 2 * np.pi, gray_frame.shape))
1463            phase_scrambling_matrix = np.exp(1j * VideoManager.shuffle_2d_array(np.angle(f_shift)))
1464
1465        magnitude = np.abs(f_shift)
1466        scrambled_f_shift = magnitude * phase_scrambling_matrix
1467        scrambled_f_transform = np.fft.ifftshift(scrambled_f_shift)
1468
1469        # Inverse Fourier
1470        scrambled_frame = np.fft.ifft2(scrambled_f_transform)
1471        scrambled_frame = np.abs(scrambled_frame)
1472
1473        # Normalize the image for display
1474        scrambled_frame_normalized = np.uint8(np.clip(scrambled_frame, 0, 255))
1475
1476        if to_rgb:
1477            scrambled_frame_normalized = cv2.cvtColor(scrambled_frame_normalized, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2BGR)
1478
1479        return scrambled_frame_normalized, phase_scrambling_matrix

Apply Fourier phase scrambling to an image.

The magnitude spectrum is preserved while phase is randomized or shuffled, which preserves low-level statistics but disrupts semantic content.

Parameters

frame : numpy.ndarray Input image (HxWx3, BGR). phase_scrambling_matrix : numpy.ndarray, optional Precomputed phase matrix to reuse for temporal consistency. seed : int, optional Random seed for reproducibility when generating new phase matrices. to_rgb : bool, optional If True, the output is converted back to 3-channel RGB.

Returns

scrambled_frame_normalized : numpy.ndarray Phase-scrambled image in uint8. phase_scrambling_matrix : numpy.ndarray Phase matrix used for scrambling, which can be reused for other frames.

@staticmethod
def shuffle_2d_array(arr): 
1481    @staticmethod
1482    def shuffle_2d_array(arr):
1483        """
1484        Randomly shuffle the elements of a 2D array.
1485
1486        This is used to randomize the phase map while preserving the global
1487        distribution of phase values.
1488
1489        Parameters
1490        ----------
1491        arr : numpy.ndarray
1492            Input 2D array.
1493
1494        Returns
1495        -------
1496        numpy.ndarray
1497            Shuffled array with the same shape as input.
1498        """
1499        # Flatten the array
1500        flat_arr = arr.flatten()
1501
1502        # Shuffle the flattened array
1503        np.random.shuffle(flat_arr)
1504
1505        # Reshape the array back to its original 2D shape
1506        shuffled_arr = flat_arr.reshape(arr.shape)
1507
1508        return shuffled_arr

Randomly shuffle the elements of a 2D array.

This is used to randomize the phase map while preserving the global distribution of phase values.

Parameters

arr : numpy.ndarray Input 2D array.

Returns

numpy.ndarray Shuffled array with the same shape as input.

1512        """
1513        Preview an array of frames in an OpenCV window.
1514
1515        Frames can be either 3D (N, H, W) or 4D (N, H, W, C). Playback runs
1516        until the sequence ends or the user presses 'q'.
1517

1519        ----------
1520        frames : numpy.ndarray
1521            Array of frames to display.

1525            Frames per second for playback.
1526        repeat : bool, optional
1527            If True, loops playback when it reaches the end.
1528
1529        Returns
1530        -------
1531        None
1532        """
1533        i = 0
1534        print('Press Q to close the window')
1535        while True:
1536            if len(frames.shape) > 3:
1537                image = frames[i, :, :, :]
1538            else:
1539                image = frames[i, :, :]
1540
1541            cv2.imshow(window, image)
1542            if cv2.waitKey(int((1 / fps) * 1000)) & 0xFF == ord('q'):
1543                break
1544
1545            if i == frames.shape[0] - 1:
1546                if repeat:
1547                    i = 0
1548                else:
1549                    break
1550            else:
1551                i = i + 1
1552
1553        cv2.destroyAllWindows()

@staticmethod
def calculate_movement_indices(frames): 
1555    @staticmethod
1556    def calculate_movement_indices(frames):
1557        """
1558        Compute movement indices for a sequence of frames.
1559
1560        Movement between each pair of consecutive frames is computed using
1561        `frame_movements`. The resulting 1D list can be used as a time series
1562        of motion energy.
1563
1564        Parameters
1565        ----------
1566        frames : numpy.ndarray
1567            4D array of frames with shape (N, H, W, C).
1568
1569        Returns
1570        -------
1571        list of int
1572            Movement index for each frame pair (length N, with the first
1573            element set to 0).
1574        """
1575
1576        # Calculate movement indices
1577        movement_indices = []
1578        movement_indices.append(0)
1579        for i in range(1, frames.shape[0]):
1580            _, mi = VideoManager.frame_movements(frames[i - 1, :, :, :], frames[i, :, :, :])
1581            movement_indices.append(mi)
1582
1583        return movement_indices

@staticmethod
def draw_plot_on_frame( frame, data_points, max_data_length=50, plot_dimensions=(200, 100), margin=10, offset=None, ymin=None, ymax=None): 
1585    @staticmethod
1586    def draw_plot_on_frame(frame, data_points, max_data_length=50, plot_dimensions=(200, 100), margin=10, offset=None,
1587                           ymin=None, ymax=None):
1588        """
1589            Draw a simple line plot of data directly on a video frame.
1590
1591            This is used to overlay movement traces on top of video frames using
1592            pure OpenCV operations.
1593
1594            Parameters
1595            ----------
1596            frame : numpy.ndarray
1597                Current video frame (HxWx3).
1598            data_points : list of float or int
1599                Data values to plot.
1600            max_data_length : int, optional
1601                Maximum number of recent data points to display.
1602            plot_dimensions : tuple of int, optional
1603                Size of the plot (width, height) in pixels.
1604            margin : int, optional
1605                Margin inside the plotting area.
1606            offset : tuple of int, optional
1607                (x, y) position of the plot in the frame. If None, the plot is
1608                placed in the bottom right corner.
1609            ymin, ymax : float, optional
1610                Explicit minimum and maximum values for scaling. If None, they
1611                are inferred from data_points.
1612
1613            Returns
1614            -------
1615            numpy.ndarray
1616                Frame with the plot drawn on it.
1617        """
1618
1619        frame = frame.copy()
1620        plot_img = np.zeros((plot_dimensions[1], plot_dimensions[0], 3), dtype=np.uint8)
1621
1622        # Scale the data to fit the plot area
1623        if data_points:
1624            if ymax is None:
1625                max_value = max(data_points)
1626            else:
1627                max_value = ymax
1628
1629            if ymin is None:
1630                min_value = min(data_points)
1631            else:
1632                min_value = ymin
1633
1634            if max_value == min_value:
1635                max_value += 1  # Avoid division by zero
1636
1637            scaled_data = [(data - min_value) / (max_value - min_value) * (plot_dimensions[1] - 2 * margin) for data in
1638                           data_points[-max_data_length:]]
1639            for i in range(1, len(scaled_data)):
1640                pt1 = (int((i - 1) * plot_dimensions[0] / max_data_length),
1641                       plot_dimensions[1] - margin - int(scaled_data[i - 1]))
1642                pt2 = (int(i * plot_dimensions[0] / max_data_length), plot_dimensions[1] - margin - int(scaled_data[i]))
1643                cv2.line(plot_img, pt1, pt2, (0, 255, 0), 2)
1644
1645        if offset is None:
1646            frame[frame.shape[0] - plot_img.shape[0]:frame.shape[0],
1647            frame.shape[1] - plot_img.shape[1]:frame.shape[1]] = plot_img
1648        else:
1649            x_offset, y_offset = offset  # Position of the plot on the frame
1650            frame[y_offset:y_offset + plot_img.shape[0], x_offset:x_offset + plot_img.shape[1]] = plot_img
1651
1652        return frame

Draw a simple line plot of data directly on a video frame.

This is used to overlay movement traces on top of video frames using pure OpenCV operations.

Parameters

frame : numpy.ndarray Current video frame (HxWx3). data_points : list of float or int Data values to plot. max_data_length : int, optional Maximum number of recent data points to display. plot_dimensions : tuple of int, optional Size of the plot (width, height) in pixels. margin : int, optional Margin inside the plotting area. offset : tuple of int, optional (x, y) position of the plot in the frame. If None, the plot is placed in the bottom right corner. ymin, ymax : float, optional Explicit minimum and maximum values for scaling. If None, they are inferred from data_points.

Returns

numpy.ndarray Frame with the plot drawn on it.

1658        The dictionary contains basic video metadata, trigger/trial information,

1660
1661        Returns

1664            Information dictionary with keys:
1665            - file

1667            - fps
1668            - total_frames

1670            - duration_sec
1671            - duration_min
1672            - num_trials

1674            - last_trigger_frame
1675            - intensity_counts
1676            - valid_trials
1677            - invalid_trials
1678        """
1679
1680        dur_sec = self.total_frames / self.fps
1681        dur_min = dur_sec / 60
1682
1683        trial_count = self.trigger_tot
1684        valid_trials = int(np.sum(self.valid))
1685        invalid_trials = int(len(self.valid) - valid_trials)
1686
1687        info_dict = {
1688            "file": self.rec,
1689            "recording_name": self.rec,
1690            "fps": self.fps,
1691            "total_frames": self.total_frames,
1692            "resolution": (self.frame_width, self.frame_height),
1693            "duration_sec": round(dur_sec, 2),
1694            "duration_min": round(dur_min, 2),
1695            "num_trials": trial_count,
1696            "first_trigger_frame": int(self.trigger_timestamp[0]) if trial_count > 0 else None,
1697            "last_trigger_frame": int(self.trigger_timestamp[-1]) if trial_count > 0 else None,
1698            "intensity_counts": dict(zip(self.stimuli[0], self.stimuli[1])),
1699            "valid_trials": valid_trials,
1700            "invalid_trials": invalid_trials,
1701        }
1702
1703        return info_dict
